intro: Paraboea xylocaulis, commonly known as the rock billygoat, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows on rocky substrates, often in woodland or scrub habitats. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a hairy texture, while its flowers are usually pink or red. Paraboea xylocaulis is adapted to well-drained soils and can thrive in partial shade to full sun.
